meanings.definition: The act of attempting to convert someone to a different religion.
meanings.sent1: The proselytism of the missionaries was met with curiosity by the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The church's proselytism efforts aimed to spread their beliefs to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The proselytism of the zealous preacher sometimes led to unexpected debates.
meanings.sent4: Her proselytism was like a gentle breeze, slowly influencing those around her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful pamphlets were part of the proselytism campaign to attract new followers.

meanings.definition: The practice of actively seeking to recruit new members to a group or cause.
meanings.sent1: The proselytism of the political party involved door-to-door campaigning.
meanings.sent2: The company's proselytism strategy focused on engaging with potential customers.
meanings.sent3: The proselytism of the enthusiastic team leader motivated others to join in.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, effective proselytism can lead to significant growth.
meanings.sent5: The proselytism efforts of the charity organization helped expand their reach.
